result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl Jay Zappa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) All payments are ordered to be paid to the BURNETT COUNTY CLERK OF COURT'S OFFICE.  The defendant has thirty (30) days to make payment of any amount ordered unless other arrangements are made with the Clerk of Court's office. Make checks or money orders payable to "BURNETT COUNTY" and send to: Burnett County Clerk of Court, 7410 Cty. Rd. K,  #115, Siren, WI 54872.    
Payments may be made either in person, by mail, or online either through wicourts.gov or through paygov.us. (subject to each website's processing fees).
2) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.  
3) At any time, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant shall not use or possess firearms while on probation.

1) No abusive contact with the victim or any of the minor children involved.
2) The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety- no use or possession of any alcohol, illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
3) Defendant is restricted from any establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol- such as bars, taverns, beer tents, and liquor stores.
The defendant shall undergo a mental health assessment and follow through with all recommendations.
The defendant must complete an AODA and comply with any treatment that may be recommended.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl Jay Zappa

records.addlTxt: Wage Assignment terminated, paid in full.

records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order- for payment of attorney fees
Invoice for Attorney Fees

01:25 PM Defendant, Carl Jay Zappa, appeared with Attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  State assures VR compliance- no victims wish to make a statement today.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Chapman: def pleading G to amended Count 1: negligent handling of a firearm (misdemeanor) - 941.20(1)(c) and Count 3: Domestic disorderly conduct; joint recommendation for probation withheld sentence on Count 1 and imposed/stayed 90 days jail on Count 3.  ADA Schmidt argues in support of the agreement, moves to amend Count 1 as stated.  Court reviews signed PLQ.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Discussion of factual basis, def stipulates to some of the facts.  Court asks for pleas.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 (as amended) and 3 and orders a JOC; Count 2 is DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  
Court orders:
Count 1- 1 year probation, withheld  $443 costs
Count 3- 1 year probation, 90 days jail imposed/stayed; $543 costs (includes $100 DOMAB surcharge).  Def to continue to pay on a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Court reserves right to enter a civil judgment if def fails to pay.
Conditions of Probation:
No abusive contact with the victim or the minor children involved.  Absolute sobriety- no drugs, alcohol, or paraphernalia.  Defendant is restricted from any establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol- such as bars, taverns, beer tents, and liquor stores.  The defendant must complete an AODA and comply with any treatment that may be recommended.  Mental health assessment and follow through.  No firearms while on probation.  2 days jail credit.
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.  Report to probation immediately.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on March 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

11:32 AM Defendant, Carl Jay Zappa, appeared with Attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Case set for prelim, def intends to waive.  State assures VR compliance.  Case proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information.  Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Tentative plea hearing requested.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG to misdemeanors entered.  Defendant does not waive time limits to prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
